title: Setup headache
content: I'm a new Thunderbird user, trying to set it up on a Mac running OS 15.6.1. I've tried to set up my email config many times, but always get this message: Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email account. Did I forget to say "Mother may I?"
creator: rlstout02860

title: Thunderbird display
content: A new hard drive was installed last week. Then had to download and install Thunderbird again. But it looks different. The window is all the incoming list. It used to be divided by the top half showing the list and the bottom half showing whichever message I clicked on. Now I have to double click on the message and it opens a new tab. How do I make it go back to the way it used to display. That was a lot less clunky than opening a new tab. I'm also having trouble finding my calendar and address book. But that's a question for the Geek Squad who told me they backed up all my data.
creator: JimBit

title: Thunderbird won't launch.
content: Thunderbird 142.0 is suddenly (after about 4 months of use) "not responding" when I attempt to launch the app on Mac 10.15. What can I do?
creator: jrc90

title: Rogers taking over Shaw
content: Hi. I was happy with Thunderbird until Rogers took over Shaw. Suddenly I cannot login. it asks me for my password for imap. I do not know what this is, I never did How can I get Thunderbird working with (Shaw) now Rogers. Thanks, John

title: adding type to a document, filling in forms
content: I have an original document I need to email each year but I have to change the document to current date.
creator: cosgrovejanette

title: Sync'ing Google Contacts and CardDAV error
content:
I am trying to add my Google Contacts as an address book in Thunderbird so that I can sync my contacts, but I get an error in the process. Below are the sterps I've taken.

I go into my address book and add a new contact list. After I select Add new CardDAV address book and enter my username in the field. Thunderbird automatically fills in the location. I select next.

A web window opens asking me to sign in with my Google account. I enter my email address and click next. This is when I get the error 

"400. That’s an error.

The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know."

The URL in the sign-in is quite complex with many parameters and referrers, but I am hesitant to post it here as it includes email addresses and other encoded information that I do not wish to get scraped.

Any ideas?

FYI: I did try CardBook, as many other posts refer to it, but I could not figure it out in a couple of minutes, so I need to read the documentation. But I would like to get the integrated solution working without the add-on if I can.
creator: michaelbelew

title: Thunderbird 142.0 (macOS, Apple Silicon) – “Download All Attachments” button not working
content:
Hi,

I am currently using Thunderbird version 142.0 on macOS 15.6.1 (Apple Silicon), and I noticed an issue with the “Download All Attachments” button.

When I open an email with multiple attachments, the button at the top of the attachment list does not work. Clicking it has no effect, and I have to manually download each attachment one by one. This is quite inconvenient.

Is this a known bug, or if there are any workarounds available?

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards, Jason
creator: jasonhsutuna
